action.action-desc: Mr. Pallone (for himself, Mr. Blumenauer, and Mr. Pascrell) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the financing of the Superfund.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Superfund Polluter Pays Act.

paragraph.text: Section 4611(e) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Application of hazardous substance superfund financing rate
subsection.text: The Hazardous Substance Superfund financing rate under this section shall apply after December 31, 1986, and before January 1, 1996, and after the date of the enactment of this subsection and before January 1, 2022.

subparagraph.text: Section 4611(b) of such Code is amended—

clause.text: by striking or exported from in paragraph (1)(A),
by striking or exportation in paragraph (1)(B), and
by striking and exportation in the heading.

subparagraph.text: Section 4611(d)(3) of such Code is amended—

clause.text: by striking or exporting the crude oil, as the case may be in the text and inserting the crude oil, and
by striking or exports in the heading.

paragraph.text: Subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: In the case of a corporation, there is hereby imposed (in addition to any other tax imposed by this subtitle) a tax equal to 0.12 percent of the excess of—

paragraph.text: the modified alternative minimum taxable income of such corporation for the taxable year, over

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the term modified alternative minimum taxable income means alternative minimum taxable income (as defined in section 55(b)(2)) but determined without regard to—

paragraph.text: the alternative tax net operating loss deduction (as defined in section 56(d)), and

subsection.text: The tax imposed by subsection (a) shall not apply to—

paragraph.text: a regulated investment company to which part I of subchapter M applies, and
a real estate investment trust to which part II of subchapter M applies.
The application of this section to taxable years of less than 12 months shall be in accordance with regulations prescribed by the Secretary.
Section 15 shall not apply to the tax imposed by this section.

subsection.text: The tax imposed by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this subsection and before January 1, 2022.
